DataElement.preferredName: Consensus Clustering Parameter Set Algorithm ConsensusClusteringAlgorithms
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A method to represent the consensus across multiple runs of a clustering algorithm, to determine the number of clusters in the data, and to assess the stability of the discovered clusters. The method can also be used to represent the consensus over multiple runs of a clustering algorithm with random restart (such as K-means, model-based Bayesian clustering, SOM, etc.), so as to account for its sensitivity to the initial conditions. It also provides for a visualization tool to inspect cluster number, membership, and boundaries.:Any factor that defines a system and determines (or limits) its performance.:A group of things of the same kind that belong together and are so used._A defined procedure for solving a problem.  Applied to a problem-solving procedure implemented in software to be executed by a computer._allowable algorithms for censensus clustering

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cluster analysis that uses stepwise partitioning of objects.

Concepts.definition: Cluster analysis that uses stepwise partitioning of objects.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A pattern recognition alogrithm that identifies patterns that together explain the data as a linear combination of expression signatures.

Concepts.definition: A pattern recognition alogrithm that identifies patterns that together explain the data as a linear combination of expression signatures.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A data visualization technique which reduces the dimensions of data through the use of self-organizing neural networks. SOMs scale well to large data sets, can identify local clusters in the data and organize them globally, and proceed in an unsupervised fashion.

Concepts.definition: A data visualization technique which reduces the dimensions of data through the use of self-organizing neural networks. SOMs scale well to large data sets, can identify local clusters in the data and organize them globally, and proceed in an unsupervised fashion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
